A Peek into the Heart and Soul of #Hoya electronics in Japan During my recent trip to Japan, I had the privilege of witnessing firsthand the extraordinary dedication of our leaders and people in Shinjuku, Nagasaka and Hachioji. The level of passion they demonstrate in fostering high trust relationships with our customers, peers, and colleagues is clearly the reason behind our organization's success. Trust is the bedrock upon which great companies are built, and it's something that each one of us can contribute to and benefit from. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or just starting your journey with Hoya, trust is a vital currency that transcends job titles and departments. It allows for smooth operations, improved collaboration, and the seamless exchange of knowledge and ideas. Trust also serves as the cornerstone for genuine and meaningful relationships, both at work and in our personal lives. In Japan, I saw a reflection of what we stands for globally: We Deliver Value and Build Trust with our Customer and People. The Japanese team’s dedication to cultivating trust was evident in every conversation, meeting, and decision. It’s this level of commitment that differentiates us and sets the path for a sustainable future for all. #hoyaelectronics #trust #people #customer #innovate #empowered #sustainable

📒 Highlight from one of our Innovation Capacity building Programme session, where we discussed what can we learn from the longevity of centuries old Japanese Companies: 🔷 Key Lessons from companies that are operating for more than a century 🔷 1️⃣ Commitment to Quality: Ensuring high-quality products and services has been a cornerstone for longevity. Companies like Yamaha and Toraya emphasize superior craftsmanship and consistency. 2️⃣ Adaptability and Innovation: Adapting to changing market conditions and investing in innovation being the crucial consideration. Sumitomo and Mitsui have shown how diversification and technological advancement can keep a company relevant in changing dynamics. 3️⃣ Strong Corporate Philosophy and Culture: A strong corporate philosophy that emphasizes ethics, integrity, and social responsibility helps build a sustainable business. Sumitomo's business principles are a prime example. 4️⃣ Long-Term Planning: Japanese companies often focus on long-term goals rather than short-term gains. This approach helps them weather economic cycles and crises. 5️⃣ Customer Focus and Brand Loyalty: Building a loyal customer base through consistent quality and understanding customer needs is vital. Yamaha's focus on quality and innovation has created a strong brand following. 6️⃣ Cultural Heritage and Identity: Leveraging cultural heritage and creating a unique brand identity can provide a competitive edge. Toraya's blend of tradition and modernity has kept it relevant for centuries. 🎯 These lessons demonstrate that a combination of quality, innovation, adaptability, strong corporate values, and long-term strategic planning can contribute significantly to the longevity and success of companies. #Innovation #Sustainable #Business Atlantis Innovation

Discovering the Power of Japanese Philosophies: 3G, 3M, and 3K 🇯🇵 Japan has long been admired for its unparalleled commitment to excellence, and at the core of this success lie three remarkable philosophies: 3G (Genchi, Genbutsu, Genjitsu), 3M (Muda, Mura, Muri), and 3K (Kimeraareta, Kihon Dori, Kichin to Mamora). These principles have not only transformed Japan's industrial landscape but also left an indelible mark on the global business world. These philosophies offer a profound understanding of continuous improvement, waste reduction, and disciplined execution. Whether you're in business, engineering, or simply seeking personal growth, these Japanese principles can illuminate your path to excellence. 🚀 #JapanesePhilosophy #ContinuousImprovement #Excellence"
